content:
Diagnosis:	Metastatic lung adenocarcinoma (lingula)

Management:	15 Jan 2024 Left upper lobectomy
		02 Feb 2024 Stereotactic radiosurgery to right frontal metastasis
		20 Feb 2024 Commenced Osimertinib

Histology:	Moderately differentiated adenocarcinoma, EGFR exon 19 deletion positive, ROS1 negative

Current Situation:	MDT review of response assessment

I am writing following today's Lung Cancer MDT discussion of [redacted name]'s case. The MDT reviewed the recent imaging performed at the 8-week assessment point on Osimertinib. CT chest shows stable appearances of the post-surgical changes in the left upper lobe. MRI brain demonstrates complete response of the previously treated right frontal metastasis with no new intracranial disease. Blood tests show stable biochemistry and normal liver function.

The patient is tolerating Osimertinib 80mg daily well with only grade 1 rash and mild diarrhea, both managed with supportive measures. Performance status remains 1.

The MDT recommendations are to continue with Osimertinib at current dose with next response assessment at 16 weeks. We will arrange CT chest/abdomen/pelvis and MRI brain for mid-June 2024. The patient will be reviewed in clinic in 4 weeks with blood tests including renal function.

primary_cancer.biomarker_status: EGFR exon 19 deletion positive, ROS1 negative

cancer_timeline.value: Stereotactic radiosurgery to right frontal metastasis
CT chest shows stable post-surgical changes in left upper lobe
MRI brain shows complete response of treated right frontal metastasis with no new disease

patient_facts.value: Stable biochemistry and normal liver function

status_updates.value: Metastatic lung adenocarcinoma with brain metastasis showing good response to targeted therapy and stereotactic radiotherapy
Stable disease on CT chest, complete response of brain metastasis
Grade 1 rash and mild diarrhea managed with supportive measures
CT chest/abdomen/pelvis and MRI brain mid-June 2024
Clinic review in 4 weeks with blood tests including renal function
